newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: SAMANCOR SELLS EMSA STAKE FOR $75 MLN.
newsitem.headline: SAMANCOR SELLS EMSA STAKE FOR $75 MLN.

text.p: South Africa's Samancor Ltd said on Thursday that it had sold its 50 percent stake in EMSA Ltd to its joint-venture partner United States firm UCAR International Corp for $75 million in cash.
EMSA makes graphite electrodes and speciality products and has a capacity of 30,000 tons a year. It is managed by UCAR and Samancor said it did not consider the stake a core asset.
UCAR is the largest maker of graphite and carbon electrodes in the world.
"The sale will not have a material impact on Samancor's earnings, but will boost its cash reserves," the firm said.
The deal is subject to the signing of final agreements and necessary regulatory approvals.
